H0.text: 32°C is the temperature that a thermometer should read when placed into a glass of boiling water.

H1.text: 100°C is the temperature the thermometer should read when placed into a glass of boiling water.

H2.text: 200°C is the temperature a thermometer should read when placed in a glass of boiling water.

H3.text: 212°C is the temperature the thermometer should read when placed into a glass of boiling water.

A4.text: water boils at 100°C (or with scientific precision: 99.97 °C (211.95 °F)) under standard pressure at sea level

A5.text: The normal boiling point of water is 100 °C (212 °F) at a pressure of 1 atm (101.325 kPa)
